name: Cheaper, Faster, Accurate Answers with Memory Summarization & Dynamic Routing!

I specialize in workflow automation with n8n, API integration, programming, and data analysis. Known for strong analytical skills and clear technical documentation.

description:
# ü§ñüí¨ Smart Telegram AI Assistant with Memory Summarization & Dynamic Model Selection

> **Optimize your AI workflows, cut costs, and get faster, more accurate answers.**

---

## üìã Description

Tired of expensive AI calls, slow responses, or bots that forget your context?  
This **Telegram AI Assistant template** is designed to **optimize cost, speed, and precision** in your AI-powered conversations.  

By combining **PostgreSQL chat memory**, **AI summarization**, and **dynamic model selection**, this workflow ensures you only pay for what you really need. Simple queries get routed to lightweight models, while complex requests automatically trigger more advanced ones. The result? **Smarter context, lower costs, and better answers.**

This template is perfect for anyone who wants to:  
- ‚ö° **Save money** by using cheaper models for easy tasks.  
- üß† **Keep context relevant** with AI-powered summarization.  
- ‚è±Ô∏è **Respond faster** thanks to optimized chat memory storage.  
- üí¨ **Deliver better answers** directly inside Telegram.  

---

### ‚ú® Key Benefits
- üí∏ **Cost Optimization**: Automatically routes simple requests to Gemini Flash Lite and reserves Gemini Pro only for complex reasoning.  
- üß† **Smarter Context**: Summarization ensures only the most relevant chat history is used.  
- ‚è±Ô∏è **Faster Workflows**: Storing user + agent messages in a single row reduces DB queries by half and saves ~0.3s per response.  
- üé§ **Voice Message Support**: Convert Telegram voice notes to text and reply intelligently.  
- üõ°Ô∏è **Error-Proof Formatting**: Safe MarkdownV2 ensures Telegram-ready answers.  

---

## üíº Use Case

This template is for **anyone who needs an AI chatbot on Telegram** that balances **cost, performance, and intelligence**.  

- Customer support teams can **reduce expenses** by using lightweight models for FAQs.  
- Freelancers and consultants can **offer faster AI-powered chats** without losing context.  
- Power users can **handle voice + text seamlessly** while keeping conversations memory-aware.  

Whether you‚Äôre scaling a business or just want a smarter assistant, this workflow adapts to your needs and budget.  

---

## üí¨ Example Interactions
- **Quick Q&A** ‚Üí Routed to Gemini Flash Lite for fast, low-cost answers.  
- **Complex problem-solving** ‚Üí Sent to Gemini Pro for in-depth reasoning.  
- **Voice messages** ‚Üí Automatically transcribed, summarized, and answered.  
- **Long conversations** ‚Üí Context is summarized, ensuring precise and efficient replies.  

---

## üîë Required Credentials
- **Telegram Bot API** (Bot Token)  
- **PostgreSQL** (Database connection)  
- **Google Gemini API** (Flash Lite, Flash, Pro)  

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions
1. üóÑÔ∏è **Create the PostgreSQL table** (`chat_memory`) from the Gray section SQL.  
2. üîå Configure the **Telegram Trigger** with your bot token.  
3. ü§ñ Connect your **Gemini API credentials**.  
4. üóÇÔ∏è Set up PostgreSQL nodes with your DB details.  
5. ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Activate the workflow and start chatting with your AI-powered Telegram bot.  

---

## üè∑ Tags
`telegram` `ai-assistant` `chatbot` `postgresql`  
`summarization` `memory` `gemini` `dynamic-routing`  
`workflow-optimization` `cost-saving` `voice-to-text`

---

## üôè Acknowledgement

A special thank you to Davide for the inspiration behind this template.  
His work on the [**AI Orchestrator that dynamically selects models based on input type**](https://n8n.io/workflows/7004-ai-orchestrator-dynamically-selects-models-based-on-input-type/) served as a foundational guide for this architecture.


---

## üí° Need Assistance?

Want to customize this workflow for your business or project? Let‚Äôs connect:  

üìß Email: [johnsilva11031@gmail.com](mailto:johnsilva11031@gmail.com)  
üîó LinkedIn: [John Alejandro Silva Rodr√≠guez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-alejandro-silva-rodriguez-48093526b/)

parameters.text: What's in this audio message from telegram user?

assignments.name: message

messageValues.message:
=You are a system that analyzes a user request and its chat history.

## Your goals:
1. Summarize the chat history into only the relevant context for the current user request.
2. Determine the difficulty of the request:
   - 1: Very simple (short answers, reminders, basic actions).
   - 2: Medium (some reasoning, structured outputs, combining info).
   - 3: Complex (multi-step reasoning, ambiguous queries, coding-level reasoning).

## Output Format:
You must return JSON strictly following this schema:

{
  "difficulty": 1 | 2 | 3,
  "context": "string - summary of the relevant history"
}

parameters.content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è Database Initialization (Chat Memory Table)

**Purpose:**  
This section is responsible for creating and preparing the `chat_memory` table in PostgreSQL. It ensures that chat interactions are stored persistently for later use in context management, summarization, and categorization.

## üîµ Input Handling (Telegram Trigger & Preprocessing)

### Purpose:
This section receives and processes incoming messages from Telegram. It detects whether the input is text, voice, or unsupported media.

### Key Steps:

*   **Telegram Trigger** ‚Äì Listens for new updates (messages from users).
*   **Input Message Router** ‚Äì Classifies whether the input is:
    *   Text message
    *   Voice message
    *   Unsupported media ‚Üí redirects to an error handler
*   **Voice Handling** ‚Äì If it‚Äôs a voice message:
    *   Downloads the file
    *   Normalizes MIME type
    *   Sends it to speech-to-text analysis
    *   Extracts the text message from audio
*   **Error Handling** ‚Äì If the input is not supported, an error message is returned.

### Optional Extension:
For multimodal and media group support (multiple files, images, videos), you can extend this section with the following template: https://n8n.io/workflows/7455-process-multiple-media-files-in-telegram-with-gemini-ai-and-postgresql-database/

## üî¥ Chat Memory Retrieval & Context Optimization

### Purpose:
This section retrieves past interactions from the database, aggregates them into a single string, and summarizes them before passing them to the agent.

### Key Steps:

*   **Normalize Input** ‚Äì Standardizes the message before processing.
*   **Get Chat Memory** ‚Äì Queries PostgreSQL for previous messages linked to the `session_id`.
*   **Aggregate** ‚Äì Combines past interactions into one text block.
*   **Summarize & Categorize** ‚Äì Uses Google Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite (low-cost, low-latency) to:
    *   Summarize the chat history.
    *   Extract relevant context.
    *   Categorize the difficulty level of the task.

### Why Summarization First?

*   Only relevant and important context is passed to the agent.
*   Reduces token usage, speeding up responses and lowering costs.
*   Prevents irrelevant history from cluttering the model‚Äôs attention.

### Advantages:

*   Saves processing time and cost by using a lightweight summarization model.
*   Produces more accurate and focused responses.
*   Optimizes memory queries by reducing data size passed downstream.

## üü£ Agent Processing & Response Delivery

### Purpose:
This section routes the request to the appropriate Gemini model depending on task difficulty, generates the final response, and sends it back to Telegram. It also updates the chat memory.

### Key Steps:

*   **Agent Node** ‚Äì Receives:
    *   User request
    *   Relevant summarized context
    *   Difficulty level
*   **Model Selector** ‚Äì Dynamically chooses the model:
    *   **Difficulty 1** ‚Üí Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite (fastest & cheapest)
    *   **Difficulty 2** ‚Üí Gemini 2.5 Flash
    *   **Difficulty 3** ‚Üí Gemini 2.5 Pro (advanced reasoning)
*   **Markdown Formatting** ‚Äì Converts model output into Telegram-compatible Markdown V2.
*   **Send Message** ‚Äì Sends the response back to Telegram.
*   **Update Chat Memory** ‚Äì Inserts a single row containing both the user and agent message.

### Why single-row storage for user & agent?

*   Since the message is sent to Telegram first and then the memory is updated, this saves an average of 0.3 seconds in response time.
*   Reduces the number of queries (`Get Chat Memory` fetches fewer rows).
*   Updates are faster since both messages are stored at once.
*   Optimizes resource usage while maintaining full conversational context.

### Advantages:

*   Cost-optimized model usage (only advanced models used when strictly necessary).
*   Faster response times by minimizing context size and database operations.

## ‚úÖ Key Benefits of This Architecture

### Cost Efficiency

*   Uses cheaper LLMs for summarization and simple queries.
*   Reserves expensive models only for complex tasks.

### Performance Optimization

*   Reduced token consumption through summarization.
*   Faster memory queries due to single-row storage.

### Flexibility & Scalability

*   Easy integration of multimodal inputs (images, audio, video).
*   Modular structure allows replacing/upgrading models or database logic.

### User Experience

*   Quick Telegram responses.
*   Consistent memory of past interactions without overwhelming the LLM.

## Acknowledgment

A special thank you to Davide for the inspiration behind this template.  
His work on the [**AI Orchestrator that dynamically selects models based on input type**](https://n8n.io/workflows/7004-ai-orchestrator-dynamically-selects-models-based-on-input-type/) served as a foundational guide for this architecture.

## üí° Need Assistance?

If you‚Äôd like help customizing or extending this workflow, feel free to reach out:  

üìß Email: [johnsilva11031@gmail.com](mailto:johnsilva11031@gmail.com)  
üîó LinkedIn: [John Alejandro Silva Rodr√≠guez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/john-alejandro-silva-rodriguez-48093526b/)
